definition: to perform a sword-dance
to dance/to wield/to brandish
double-edged sword/CL:口[kou3],把[ba3]/classifier for blows of a sword
variant of 劍|剑[jian4]

lit. Xiang Zhuang performs the sword dance, but his mind is set on Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] (idiom, refers to plot to kill Liu Bang during Feast at Hongmen 鴻門宴|鸿门宴[Hong2 men2 Yan4] in 206 BC)/fig. an elaborate deception hiding malicious intent
see 項莊舞劍，意在沛公|项庄舞剑，意在沛公[Xiang4 Zhuang1 wu3 jian4 , yi4 zai4 Pei4 gong1]
pinyin: Xiang4 Zhuang1 wu3 jian4 , zhi4 zai4 Pei4 gong1

definition: lit. Xiang Zhuang performs the sword dance, but his mind is set on Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] (idiom); refers to 206 BC plot to murder Liu Bang, aka Duke of Pei 沛公[Pei4 gong1] and the future Han emperor, during a sword dance at Feast at Hongmen 鴻門宴|鸿门宴[Hong2 men2 Yan4]/an elaborate deception to hide malicious intent
pinyin: Xiang4 Zhuang1 wu3 jian4 , yi4 zai4 Pei4 gong1

sentences.english: This is a place where Fan Li practiced with his sword after his retirement.
sentences.chinese: 这里是范蠡隐居后经常舞剑的地方。

sentences.english: No sword in hand while having a sword in your heart is the highest insight of performing swordplay.
sentences.chinese: 手中无剑，心中有剑那是舞剑的最高境界。

sentences.english: I am learning how to fence.

definition: to play the xiao 簫|箫[xiao1] (mouth organ)/to beg while playing pipes; cf politician Wu Zixu 伍子胥[Wu3 Zi3 xu1], c. 520 BC destitute refugee in Wu town, 吳市吹簫|吴市吹箫[Wu2 shi4 chui1 xiao1]/to busk/virtuoso piper wins a beauty, cf 玉人吹簫|玉人吹箫[yu4 ren2 chui1 xiao1]/(slang) fellatio/blowjob
to play the zither/classical variant of 彈琴|弹琴[tan2 qin2]
to play or strum a lute or other stringed instrument
to wave/to brandish
to recite poetry
to dance/to wield/to brandish
elegant/graceful/smart/to dance lightly
to sing loudly/to lift one's voice in song
dancer's posture and movement
graceful (esp. of female posture)/lithe
(to start) dancing lightly and gracefully
to sing and dance/general term for a round dance
flowing sleeves (part of theatrical costume)
to move as in a dance/to wave (some implement)/to flourish/(of eyes, hands etc) to dance/to flutter
to go for a walk in the moonlight
xiao, a Chinese musical instrument of ancient times, similar to panpipes
